title: Nigl 2015 Gelber Muskateller (Niederösterreich)
description: Hints of white blossom mix with faint notes of pear to create a delicately balanced, fresh and spring-like wine that is as light as gossamer. This has verve and freshness, tender, blossomy aromatics and immense charm. Drink as soon as possible while its elderflower notes shimmer lastingly.

title: Ronco dei Tassi 2011 Cjarandon Riserva Red (Collio)
description: Scents of vanilla, French oak and dark berry carry over to the palate along with black cherry, baking spice and a hint of mineral. Brisk acidity provides the backbone.

title: Laurence Féraud NV Plan Pégau Red (Vin de France)
description: This bottling is a blend comprised of wines from the 2011–2013 vintages, hence the nonvintage Vin de France labeling. Aromas of leather, clove and cinnamon come with a hint of adhesive bandage. The tannins are firm, so pair this with rare beef or lamb to bring forward the long, mouthwatering finish.

title: The Dot 2015 Austrian Apple Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Generous fruit rises from the glass: Juicy pear and red apple, mellowed with a dollop of yeasty roundedness. The palate is supple, fresh and crunchy. Everything here is appetizing and moreish. This is easy but fun. Drink soon.

title: R&A; Pfaffl 2015 Vom Haus Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Yeasty savor, tick. Fresh zestiness, tick. Lemon and pear flavors, tick. This must be archetypal, soft and fresh Grüner. This one has a fluid, supple body and goes down far too easily, leaving a wake of peppery pear behind.

title: Rally Point Wines 2013 Limited Production Marsanne-Roussanne (Sonoma Valley)
description: A 50-50 split of the two varieties, there's a lot to like in this wine, from its opening steely aromas to its surprisingly robust body of apricot and pineapple, with a crisp floral aspect keeping it balanced on the palate. A curious suggestion of marshmallow closes things out.

title: Pacific Rim 2014 Hahn Hill Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of the underside of a pineapple and freshly cut mango are followed by just off-dry, exuberant tropical fruit flavors. It's a mouthful of fruit that goes down easy.

title: Paraiso Vineyards 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Red apple, light pineapple and key lime cream show on the nose of this twist-top bottling from the regionally pioneering Smith family. The palate is tightly wound and full of intriguingly delicate depth, offering pencil lead, shiso leaf, daikon radish, lemon-lime, sea foam and oyster shells.

title: Pear Valley 2013 Inspiration Red (Paso Robles)
description: Plump raspberries, darker blackberries, a touch of red and purple flowers, a bit of pork fat and a splash of root beer show on the nose of this blend of 51% Syrah, 30% Grenache, 12% Mourvèdre and 7% Zinfandel. It's full and fruit on the palate with cooked blackberries, surounding a line of lavender, white pepper and thyme.

title: Stefano Antonucci 2011 Tardivo Ma Non Tardo  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of pressed chamomile, Spanish Broom and toasted nut. The rich, rather evolved palate offers pineapple, candied citrus zest, dried herb and a hint of papaya freshened by rather fresh acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Steininger 2013 Cuveé Lisa Red (Niederösterreich)
description: While the nose gives little away, the palate is smooth and fruit-laden. A mix of cinnamon-scented red and black forest berries appears on the smooth midpalate which has just the slightest grip of tannin. This has a mellow, soft theme but nonetheless carries all the necessary freshness on a medium body.

title: Monchiero Carbone 2015 Cecu D'la Biunda  (Roero)
description: Aromas suggesting honeysuckle, citrus blossom, honeydew melon, aromatic herb and a whiff of tomato vine lead the way. The round, medium-bodied palate is full of grapefruit, white peach and mature Bosc pear while a mineral note closes the finish.

title: Moser 2011 Rosé Extra Brut Pinot Nero (Trento)
description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this lively sparkler offers aromas of woodland berry and toasted almond. The crisp palate doles out watermelon, apple and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity and a firm perlage.

title: Moshin 2013 Rosalina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A high mark of acidity complements the crisp flavors of cherry, strawberry and cranberry here, accented by woody forest notes and a bitter, savory component of black tea. Light-bodied, it has enough body and weight to stay relevant through the finish.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2014 Rust Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Full-fruited blueberry fills nose and palate with pure aroma. The body has perceptible but gentle grip while some notes of iron-oxide and ripe, red cherry creep in. There is liveliness, freshness and drive. Drink soon.

title: H. & M. Hofer 2015 Von den Rieden Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: A very fresh and superfruited nose suggests not only pear but peach, melon and citrus. The palate adds some spice and savoriness to that with a yeasty edge but the primary fruit remains the central theme on this light-bodied, easy-drinking Grüner. Drink soon.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: While stridently oak driven, this Chardonnay keenly maintains a core of fresh pear and apple flavor amidst layers of spice and caramel. It's supple and silky in texture, finishing on a lingering kiss of vanilla cream.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2013 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: High toned lychee, melon and rose perfume abounds on this classically aromatic Gewürztraminer. Semidry in style, it balances juicy, primary tropical fruit flavors against crisp tangerine acidity. Big in body and ripeness, its lusciously textured mouthfeel clings deliciously on the finish.

title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2014 Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)
description: Very tentative hints of earthy red fruit are all that can be discerned on the nose. The palate is lithe and soft and slightly edged with fine sprays of white pepper amidst very tender red fruit: is it cranberry? Red fruit just shimmers through and wants to be coaxed out. The delicate aftertaste of forest floor, cranberry and pepper is a joy.

title: St. Pauls 2012 Passion Riserva Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Blueberry, violet and nutmeg aromas take center stage. On the balanced palate, vanilla and dark baking spice underscore black cherry and cassis while dusty tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2018.

title: Le Vigne 2013 Di Domenico Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: Savory touches of herb-crusted poultry, leather and turned earth show on the nose of this bottling from East Paso. Dried red fruit, rich leather and smoked pork elements and a touch of coffee on the finish show on the palate, where the tannins are a touch firm right now.

title: Hirsch 2013 San Andreas Fault Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is restrained and wound a little tight, but it has great grip and nervy flavors. Note the woodsy and rhubarb aromas, tight cherry and cranberry flavors, a lean texture due to firm acidity and fine-grained tannins.

title: Livio Felluga 2009 Picolit (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Muted aromas of toast, oak, crème caramel and a hint of aromatic herb lead the nose. The full-bodied palate doles out acacia honey, dried fig and vanilla. It's rather shy on freshness and very sweet but not quite cloying.

title: Savage Grace 2014 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Reserved green apple, lees, flower and mineral aromas lead to off-dry green apple and stone fruit flavors. The acidity gives the palate some snap.

title: Villa Maria 2013 Cellar Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Concentrated yet supple, this dark Pinot should be true to its name and evolve nicely for up to 10 years. Cedar, cola and vanilla notes frame black cherry fruit that slowly fades away on the finish.

title: Villa Russiz 2014 Pinot Bianco (Collio)
description: Delicately scented, this refined white opens with a fragrance reminiscent of white flower and orchard fruit. The svelte, linear palate offers crisp green apple, pear and mineral alongside racy acidity.

title: Tertulia 2013 Estate Vineyards Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A blend of the winery's Whistling Hills and Riviere Galets vineyards, this wine brings aromas of funk, coffee, tire rubber, blue fruit and smoke. The cranberry and cherry notes are sweet and full flavored, hanging on the finish.

title: Tessier Winery 2014 Morelli Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This producer makes small amounts of minimal-intervention wines from a handful of California appellations and this one does a good job of capturing Russian River. Peppery and steeped in dried herb and lavender, it goes light on the oak to show tightly woven tannin and structure, but the floral aromatics, especially of rose, really shine.

title: Tinpot Hut 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This wine is silky and medium bodied. An attractive array of rose-like notes mingle with hints of cola, cinnamon and damp earth on the nose. Cherry flavors on the palate fade slowly on the elegant finish.

title: Tenuta di Tavignano 2013 Misco Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting toasted almond, Spanish broom and grapefruit. The bright, linear palate shows lemon zest, chopped herb and mineral alongside tangy acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
